content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Furnace at position (1, 1)
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone furnace (position (1, 1)) with fuel (coal) and currently processing copper-ore into copper-plate.

### Wooden chests
Consists of the following entities:
- Wooden chest (position (3.5, 1.5)) containing 20 iron-plates.
- Wooden chest (position (3.5, 3.5)) containing 50 iron-plates.
- Wooden chest (position (3.5, 5.5)) with no items.

### Lab at position (6.5, 1.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Lab (position (6.5, 1.5)) currently without power.

### Small electric pole at position (6.5, 3.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Small electric pole (position (6.5, 3.5)) providing power to the lab.

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors when crafting items due to insufficient ingredients
- Ensure you have enough required ingredients in your inventory before attempting to craft items. In this case, ensure you have enough copper-plates to craft Automation Science Packs.

### Errors when inserting items into a full inventory
- Check the inventory of the target entity (like a furnace) before inserting items. If the inventory is full, you will not be able to insert additional items.

### Errors when attempting to insert items that are not available
- Make sure you have the required items in your inventory before attempting to insert them into another entity. In this case, ensure you have copper-ore before trying to insert it into the furnace.

### Errors when attempting to insert incompatible items
- Verify that the item you are trying to insert is compatible with the target entity's inventory. In this case, ensure you are not trying to insert copper-ore into a furnace that already contains iron-ore.

### Errors when monitoring research progress
- Ensure that the research lab is placed correctly on the map and is accessible. If there are no labs available, you will not be able to monitor research progress.

### Errors when trying to find the nearest lab
- Make sure that at least one lab is built and placed on the map before attempting to find the nearest lab. If no labs exist, the operation will fail.

### Errors when crafting a lab
- Ensure that you have the correct materials required to craft the lab. Check your inventory for the necessary components.

### Errors with unsupported operand types
- Verify that you are using the correct data types in calculations. For instance, ensure that you are not trying to add incompatible types, such as a model attribute and an integer.

### Errors when placing electric poles
- Ensure that there is a suitable position available for placing electric poles. Check for existing objects in the way before attempting to place.

### Errors when connecting to power sources
- Ensure that the lab is within range of a power source. If the lab status indicates no power, check the connections and ensure poles are correctly placed to provide power.
